channel.title: dynamo on BIMGEEK
channel.description: Recent content in dynamo on BIMGEEK

item.title: Visualizing Room Data in Power Bi
item.description: Understanding and visualizing building data is essential to any data-driven workflow and being Speckle a data platform, it follows quite naturally that you might want to analyze streams and commits coming from it. And thats what we are going to do in this tutorial. I am going to show you how you can visualize Revit Room data in Power BI using Speckle connectors. Let’s get started!üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Prefer watching than reading? Here’s a video too!

item.title: Revit Elements to Rhino Using Speckle
item.description: In this tutorial, we’ll send some Revit elements to Rhino and the geometry in Rhino will contain selected Revit parameters. This workflow contains a lot of use cases but I will create a really simple script that will color Revit elements by their properties, just to demonstrate the structure of the data that comes from Speckle and how we can use it in the workflow. Let’s get started!üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Prefer watching than reading?

item.title: Create Revit Sheets from Excel
item.description: In this tutorial, we’ll create Revit Sheets from Excel table containing Sheet Names and Numbers with Dynamo. Especially in large scale projects, creating hundreds of sheets manually just doesn’t make any sense. Since we are already populating sheet names, numbers and any other data in Excel, why not use that data in Dynamo directly and automate this task. Let’s just do thatüëá! Prefer watching than reading? Here’s a video too! Prerequisites To follow this tutorial you’ll need the following:
